metadata.Title: CVE-2020-13934 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An h2c direct connection to Apache Tomcat 10.0.0-M1 to 10.0.0-M6, 9.0.0.M5 to 9.0.36 and 8.5.1 to 8.5.56 did not release the HTTP/1.1 processor after the upgrade to HTTP/2. If a sufficient number of such requests were made, an OutOfMemoryException could occur leading to a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-13934` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtomcat9-embed-java - 9.0.37-3
libtomcat9-java - 9.0.37-3
tomcat9 - 9.0.37-3
tomcat9-admin - 9.0.37-3
tomcat9-common - 9.0.37-3
tomcat9-examples - 9.0.37-3
tomcat9-user - 9.0.37-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tomcat9 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '9.0.37-3').
